text: Does his  driving correspond to his ability to do his job ?
@BobMcCow exactly
I'm uncomfortable this evening about Chris Huhne's resignation
@peter_surtees but in reality it's your Head so look after him or her
@samkru I fully intend to despite the hopes of Alasdair Smith ( Anti-academy Aliance)
@peter_surtees governors need to wake up to the fact that their Head is the main player and respect that.
@teach_matters good teachers and good teaching matters
Headteachers - I'm tired. Please stop fighting the Academy agenda. It will happen.
Teachers have been planning and in school prepping their rooms - from labelling coat pegs to creating individual targets - for your child
The average head teacher will have worked during at least 3 of their summer break weeks as a minimum
Head teachers and teachers need more respect - let's start the new academic year with respect for heads and their staff
An average school has 300 pupils / 500 parents - that's a lot of opinions - make a difference where it counts and where it helps.
We can not expect our heads to change policy and day to day running on the opinion or fantastic "idea" every parent has
Leave the running of schools to our head teachers and stop wasting their time by giving your opinion on everything
Parents - have a say in your schools to inform heads and governors of your views for policy creating - stop trying to run them yourselves
I know I want parents to have a say in their child's school but you would not believe the stream of trivia they involve themselves in.
Unfortunately these youths are not victims of the coalition cuts but products of the labour government's welfare state!
@Michael_Gove spoke to a Primary Head last night - she had timetables , staff training , building work , paperwork etc- whinge whinge whine!
Well they are off on holiday again and still moaning! Wait until they see my cuts to capital spending!
Head teachers have a week off in February and they still say they are knackered - try my job - that's what I say!
